alert.note: Alert for Essex; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 11:42AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Virginia and eastern Virginia, including the following counties, in east central Virginia, Essex, Richmond and Westmoreland. In eastern Virginia, Lancaster, Middlesex and Northumberland. * WHEN...Until 245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1142 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Tappahannock, Warsaw, Kilmarnock, Robley, Callao, Fair Port, Lancaster, White Stone, Morattico, Farnham, Heathsville, Sharps, Haynesville, Wicomico Church, Jamaica, Lewisetta, Church View, Kinsale, Center Cross and Dunnsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Essex; Lancaster; Middlesex; Northumberland; Richmond; Westmoreland
